title: A proposal for the implementation of electronic health record in Indonesia
abstract: The healthcare industry has been one of the most important sectors for years and still is developing. As with other industries, the healthcare industry has also evolved throughout the years. From a regular healthcare practice to the involvement of technology. The healthcare industry also reflects the revolution of its industry which is at its fourth revolution. The presence of technology and computer advancement have given the chance to increase the quality of healthcare. This paperâ€™s topic discusses aspects of the industrial system and its optimization with the use of data. One of the advancements right now is the use of electronic healthcare record (EHR), a digital form of regular healthcare record. EHR is used for various purposes which includes an optimized healthcare delivery system as well as improvements. EHR is also used to analyse data for research which is important for future developments and improvements. The implementation of EHR has not been done yet in Indonesia. Many researchers have inquired about the readiness of Indonesian in using EHR as well as the barriers of it. However, there has not been a discussion about the implementation of EHR, specifically in the day-to-day process or even further development of EHR in Indonesia which could improve the quality of healthcare.
contributors: Ir. Kardi Teknomo (Advisor 1); Indriati Njoto Bisono (Examination Committee 1); Karina Agustin, S.T., M.B.A. (Examination Committee 2)
